name: Monotropa uniflora
description:
The ghost plant or Indian pipe is the flower of a perennial plant. Many people mistake this flower for a mushroom, but it is actually parasitic, feeding on fungi, and does not create any energy from the sun like most plants.

The entire above ground portion can be put in alcohol and used as a pain relieving tincture.

Photographer: my wife
One edition of the two will be reserved for her.
